Creating A Docker For Desktop Cluster

Prerequisites

  • Git
  • GitBash (if Windows)
  • kubectl
  • Docker For Desktop

Getting The Code

git clone https://github.com/vfarcic/k8s-specs.git

cd k8s-specs

Getting The Code

  • We cloned the repository that contains (almost) all the examples weâ€™ll use in this course

Configuring Docker For Desktop

  • Go To Preferences > Kubernetes
  • Check Enable Kubernetes
  • Check Kubernetes as the default orchestrator
  • Click the Advanced tab and set CPUs to 2, and Memory to 4.0

Configuring Docker For Desktop

kubectl apply -f \
